body.p: The Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky -- Your Petitioner, John D Williams, would most respectfully state that at at the JuneAugst Term of the Green Circuit Court ^1860^, he was charged with and found guilty of keeping a "Tippling House" (by some malicious persons) which he most positively states is not true and had it not been that he was disabled from attending Court On account of a broken Leg (which has to a great extent rendered him a cripple for life) the charge would not have been sustained -- He most solemnly states that although he is poor and very poor he never did permit disorderly conduct at or about his house -- Being unable to pay the fine he most earnestly prays his Excellency the Governor to remit the fine or so much of it as in his wisdom he may deem right and proper -- We the undersigned petitioners join in requisting His Excellency to grant the prayer of the Petitioner
